author: Special Correspondent
text:
Members of Joint Action Council of Tamil Nadu Teachers’ Organisation staging a protest in Ramanathapuram and Dindigul (right) on Saturday. — Photos: L. Balachandarand G. Karthikeyan

Members of Joint Action Council of Tamil Nadu Teachers’ Organisation staging a protest in Ramanathapuram and Dindigul (right) on Saturday. — Photos: L. Balachandarand G. Karthikeyan

Members of Joint Action Council of Tamil Nadu Teachers’ Organisation (JACTTO) staged a picketing agitation here on Saturday, pressing their 15-point charter of demands, including introduction of old pension scheme and removal of anomalies in the sixth pay commission.

JACTTO district coordinator V. Ramamurthy, who led the agitation along with district presidents of various teachers’ associations, said that the stir was part of a three-day State-wide picketing programme announced by the organisation. More than 400 JACTTO members, including 185 women, were courted arrest after they squatted on the road in front of the Union office here. Traffic was disrupted on the busy Ramanathapuram-Rameswaram National Highway before police arrested and removed them.

They were detained in a marriage hall and released in the evening.

The picketing would continue at the same place on Sunday and Monday, Mr. Ramamurthy said.

School functioning would be affected on Monday as teachers, right from elementary school to higher secondary schools, would take part in the agitation, he said.

In all, 439 JACTTO members were arrested and released, police said.
title: Teachers stage protest
